marketNews.title: PIPA: New Controller Candidate to Inject Assets Worth IDR 3 Trillion
marketNews.content:
Shield On Service ($SOSS) announced that ALSOK Co., Ltd. purchased approximately 36 million SOSS shares at a price of 590 rupiah per share on September 30, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 21.2 billion rupiah and was intended for investment purposes. After this transaction, the ownership of ALSOK Co., Ltd. in SOSS increased from none to 4.5%.
Boston Furniture Industries ($SOFA) announced that PT Asia Investment Capital plans to acquire 70.96% of the company's shares from existing shareholders, namely Hardy Satya, Yohan Satya, and Dimas Adiyasa. This transaction is still in the negotiation stage, so the transaction value has not been announced. After this transaction, PT Asia Investment Capital will become the new controller in SOFA.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need To Know...
marketNews.content:
Reuters reported that the latest draft of the Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Bill (P2SK) no longer contains explicit provisions allowing the DPR (House of Representatives) to recommend the dismissal of Bank Indonesia's board of governors, although the latest regulation includes a provision that the performance of the central bank and other financial regulators will be reviewed by the DPR. Although the DPR's authority over Bank Indonesia is softer in the latest draft, Reuters reported that this can still raise concerns among investors regarding the risk of political interference, considering the DPR currently consists of a large coalition of President Prabowo Subianto. Reuters also reported that the latest version of the Bill has a provision requiring Bank Indonesia to implement "policies and policy mixes that create a conducive economic environment for real sector growth and job creation," confirming previous reports regarding plans to expand Bank Indonesia's mandate. The Chairman of Commission XI of the DPR, Mukhamad Misbakhun, told Reuters that this latest version of the Bill will be brought to the plenary session to be enacted into law.
Tin futures prices on the London Metal Exchange rose +1.7% to 36,013 US dollars per ton at the close of trading on Wednesday (1/10), driven by potential tightening of global supply due to crackdowns on illegal mining in Indonesia. With this price increase, Bloomberg reported that tin prices have jumped +24% year-to-date. Earlier, President Prabowo Subianto ordered authorities earlier this week to close tin smuggling routes mined illegally from 1,000 mining locations in Bangka Belitung.
The DPR plenary meeting on Thursday (2/10) approved the revision of Law No. 19/2003 concerning State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) into law. This new regulation will replace the Ministry of BUMN with the BUMN Regulatory Agency (BP BUMN). In addition, there are at least 11 other substantive points changed from the previous BUMN Law, such as the prohibition of simultaneous tenure for ministers and deputy ministers as BUMN officials, up to the arrangement of the investment holding structure and operational holding company at BPI Danantara.
PT Freeport Indonesia President Director, Tony Wenas, said on Thursday (2/10) that the plan to divest 12% of PT Freeport Indonesia shares from Freeport-McMoRan (NYSE: FCX) to the government is still under discussion among stakeholders. Previously, Danantara CEO, Rosan Roeslani, claimed that this transaction would be completed soon, adding that the transfer of shares would be free of charge. Nevertheless, Danantara CIO, Pandu Sjahrir, told Bloomberg that this transaction is not free, although he did not elaborate further. Currently, the government through MIND ID holds a 51% ownership in PT Freeport Indonesia.

marketNews.title: 5 Characteristics of a Healthy Stock According to Agungsutiyono
marketNews.content: "Remembering good does not necessarily mean healthy, because there are still other factors that support a company to be healthy and it depends on each investor, but basically, investors look at it from this aspect." - agungsutiyono

tickerNews.title: Petrosea ($PTRO) Projects EBITDA to Grow +70% CAGR in 2024-2026F
tickerNews.content:
Petrosea ($PTRO) in an information disclosure related to its public expose material projects consolidated EBITDA in 2026F to reach 306 million US dollars, a higher +61% compared to Stockbit's estimate which we wrote in Unboxing Mining Contractor Sector. Overall, the company's revenue and EBITDA are projected to increase at a CAGR of +42% and +70% in 2024-2026F, respectively. Here are some important notes from us regarding PTRO's performance projections:
The company expects revenue to grow +43% YoY to 991 million US dollars in 2025F and +41% YoY to 1.4 billion US dollars in 2026F. Consolidated EBITDA is projected to grow higher, +91% YoY to 203 million US dollars in 2025F and +51% YoY to 306 million US dollars in 2026F. For context, revenue projections for 2025F and 2026F conveyed by the company are respectively +9% and +45% higher than Stockbit's estimates, while EBITDA projections for 2025F and 2026F are respectively +21% and +61% higher than Stockbit's estimates.
PTRO bases its revenue and EBITDA growth projections on organic growth and contributions from the HBS group and the Hafar group acquired this year. The contribution of both is expected to push up PTRO's EBITDA margin to 22% in 2026F, compared to an estimate of 21% without the acquisition. The HBS Group is engaged in mining services and construction solutions in Papua New Guinea, while the Hafar group is a company in the offshore engineering, procurement, construction, and installation sector.
Synergy HBS Group: Regional Expansion, Better EBITDA Margin
The company explained that the acquisition of the HBS group expands PTRO's footprint to Papua New Guinea by utilizing the HBS group's operational base and customer network, such as Newmont, St. Barbara, and Harmony Gold. Furthermore, PTRO plans to optimize funding, HR, and procurement sides through its internal ecosystem. PTRO estimates that the EBITDA margin from HBS will reach 30% in 2026F, higher than the projected PTRO EBITDA margin before the acquisition at 21% in 2026F. For context, PTRO announced plans to acquire 100% of the HBS Group shares on August 1, 2025, with a total transaction value of 25.8 million US dollars or approximately 429.3 billion rupiah.
Synergy Hafar Group: Expansion of Offshore Oil and Gas Industry Business
PTRO explained that the acquisition of the Hafar group aims to open new business opportunities for the company into the offshore EPCI and shipping business — specifically barges for pipeline installation — while gaining access to networks of key clients in the oil and gas and LNG industries, such as Pertamina and Petronas. Similar to HBS, PTRO plans to optimize funding, HR, and procurement sides. The company also projects that the EBITDA margin from the Hafar group will reach 34% in 2026F. For context, PTRO, through its subsidiary, PT Petrosea Engineering Procurement Construction, announced the acquisition of 51% in 2 Hafar group business entities on August 15, 2025, with a transaction value of approximately 400 billion rupiah, while the remaining 49% was acquired by Rukun Raharja ($RAJA) for 384 billion rupiah.
Key Takeaway
We view this performance projection release positively, given that previously there was no information regarding the contribution of acquired companies, such as potential additional revenue, margin profiles, and client networks. Specifically regarding margins, we assess that the EBITDA margins of both companies being >30% in 2026F are relatively high levels, which can positively impact PTRO's overall EBITDA margin. We see that the potential additional EBITDA from these two acquisitions will exceed the impact of increased financial expenses (from acquisition financing), thus still positively impacting the company's net profit.

tickerNews.title: Multi Makmur Lemindo ($PIPA) New Controller Candidate to Inject Assets Worth IDR 3 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Multi Makmur Lemindo ($PIPA): The Corporate Secretary of Multi Makmur Lemindo, Kevin Mayola, said on Wednesday (1/10) that the company's new controller candidate, Morris Capital Indonesia, will inject assets worth 3 trillion rupiah. Kevin stated that the asset injection will be the main capital for PIPA to expand its business from upstream to downstream, especially related to oil and gas utilities and infrastructure. Kevin added that the acquisition process of 57% of PIPA shares by Morris Capital Indonesia has entered the final stage, with the due diligence process reaching 95% and targeted to be completed as soon as possible in the near future.

tickerNews.title: Futura Energi Global ($FUTR) New Controller Directs Company to Become New Renewable Energy Holding Company
tickerNews.content: Futura Energi Global ($FUTR) said in a clarification to the IDX that the company's new controller, PT Aurora Dhana Nusantara (Ardhantara), directs the company to become a holding company in the new and renewable energy (NRE) sector. FUTR explained that the company's involvement in this business will be realized in the form of share participation in operational entities and development of capital structure. Ardhantara, through its business entities, owns geothermal assets in the exploration stage, with a potential capacity of ~220 MW and initial investment of more than 80 million US dollars or approximately 1.2 trillion rupiah. Until the end of 2025, FUTR explained that Ardhantara will still focus on carrying out mandatory tender offers, and considering a rights issue option for FUTR.

tickerNews.title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN) Plans to Issue Bonds and Sukuk for Working Capital Loans to Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi plans to issue bonds worth 1.35 trillion rupiah and sukuk worth 650 billion rupiah, with the funds obtained intended for providing working capital loans to PT Multi Tambangjaya Utama, the company's subsidiary. These bonds and sukuk - which have received idA and idA(sy) ratings from Pefindo, respectively - will be offered in 2 tenors, namely 5 years (interest/yield 8.5%) and 7 years (interest/yield 9%).

tickerNews.title: Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd. (Affiliate of $BREN Controller) Sells ~86.6 Million BREN Shares to Increase Free Float
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy shareholders affiliated with the controller, Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd., sold ~86.6 million BREN shares on September 29-October 1, 2025, with an average price of 8,762 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 758.7 billion rupiah and was intended to increase the free float of shares circulating in the market. After this transaction, the ownership of Green Era Energy decreased from ~21.92% to ~21.86%.

tickerNews.title: Commissioner Alexander Ramlie Sells ~10.4 Million Shares of Amman Mineral Internasional ($AMMN)
tickerNews.content: Amman Mineral Internasional Commissioner, Alexander Ramlie, sold approximately 10.4 million AMMN shares on September 26-30, 2025, with an average price of 6,997 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 72.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of Alexander Ramlie in AMMN decreased from 0.435% to 0.42%.

tickerNews.title: Controller Hapsoro Sells ~325 Million Shares of Bukit Uluwatu Villa ($BUVA) for Profit Realization
tickerNews.content: Bukit Uluwatu Villa Controller, Hapsoro, sold approximately 325 million BUVA shares on September 26, 2025, at an average price of 450 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 146.3 billion rupiah. This transaction was aimed at profit realization and increasing the free float of shares in the public. After this transaction, Hapsoro's ownership in BUVA decreased from 5.56% to 3.99%.

tickerNews.title: PT Humpuss Transportasi Kimia Sells ~1.2 Billion Shares of Humpuss Maritim Internasional ($HUMI) for Investment Strategy
tickerNews.content: Humpuss Maritim Internasional shareholder, PT Humpuss Transportasi Kimia, sold approximately 1.2 billion HUMI shares at a price of 50 rupiah per share on September 26, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 59.1 billion rupiah and was intended for investment strategy. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Humpuss Transportasi Kimia in HUMI decreased from 6.55% to none.
